intro: Phacelia pediculoides, commonly known as the slender phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky areas. It has slender, branching stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Phacelia pediculoides is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
